physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a group of women. One woman in the middle is dressed in a collared top and skirt. The rest of the women are wearing matching white tops and dark skirts. The group is posing standing up in a row, all facing towards the camera. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of group of women
subject_terms_2: Photographs Portrait photography Women Portraits, Group
